website_summaries.verdict: An escape ladder light enough that children can use.
pros: Rated to hold up to 1,000 lbs
Fits in a small space for storage
Rungs have an anti-slip coating to help you descend safely
cons: The ladder is hard to re-pack, which will make it difficult to practice with

customer_reviews.title: Safety is paramount.
customer_reviews.text: As a firefighter this was one of the first things we purchased after we moved into our 2 story house. There is simply no reason not to invest in something so cheap that can save your life. Lord willing you will not need this device but you do not want to be in the position of needing it and not having it. I recommend at least 1 in the upstairs of your housing unit in a place that is easy to get to. This ladder is well made and easy to deploy if necessary so that even kids can do it if left at home and the worst happens. I would certainly recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: D&R

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: The ladder opens up & folds back in really easily. I put it in an open plastic container & slid it under my bed for storage (which is awesome, because finding a place to put stuff is always half the battle in my small apartment.) The instructions say it's a "one time use", but it seems really sturdy. I hope to never have to use it, but feel comforted having it around.
customer_reviews.author: You'llThankMeLater

customer_reviews.title: If you have a two story, get one and don't experience a bad or sad story in a fire!
customer_reviews.text: We got this to stay current with getting down from the second floor bedroom in a fire. Now at mid 60's, we don't want to have to jump out and hit the ground as we would probably fracture a hip or break a leg. If you have multiple rooms and kids on the second floor bedrooms, get one for each bedroom. When you get them do not activate the ladder unless you are going to use it..... it takes a while to put back into the correct way! Don't forget, 1 all purpose fire extinguisher per room per floor...
customer_reviews.author: GO

customer_reviews.title: One time use only?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this ladder thinking that we could have fire drills with our grandsons, the youngest of whom is suddenly terrified of fire. I *never* would have ordered it had I known it was one use only! Kind of hard to practice going up and down a ladder that's only good once. That information needs to be CLEARLY noted on the description! Needless to say, I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: JDGK

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I had to return, this product was dangerous because the metal on the steps was very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: DCar

customer_reviews.title: Terrifying! Bent and twisted instantly at test run
customer_reviews.text: We pulled this out of the box to test it and the instant my husband (165lbs) stepped out the window, the ladder bent and twisted. If I wasn't holding it at the top, he would have fallen from the 2nd story window to the ground. Horribly unsafe and incredibly disappointed. I'm so glad we tried this before we might need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacksmom

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for..
customer_reviews.text: Its annoying that this isn't considered reusable. Still, I've done a practice run with my kids since they are only 50 pounds and it seems fine. The sides are nylon straps. The plastic strap that holds the ladder bunched up (grey w/ velcro) broke on the second time that I brought it back up through the window. I guess it will work in an emergency. I probably wouldn't buy it again though.
customer_reviews.author: playinpearls

customer_reviews.title: Just a little piece of mind...
customer_reviews.text: Just a little piece of mind... hopefully we will never need to use it. Recommend unpacking and removing packaging so that you won't have to deal with tape, cardboard, and plastic in the event of an emergency, then either place back in the box or in a location close to where you will need it. The velcro that holds the ladder rungs together is nice and will be easy for anyone to remove if needed. We had a great sit down with the kids to talk about fire safety and they thought the ladder was very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine K.

customer_reviews.title: My brother in law is a fire fighter and he recommended these. I sleep better at night knowing my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a two story house. I needed ladders for my upstairs so if we needed to escape we could. I have four kids and had been worried about if we had a fire. My brother in law is a fire fighter and he recommended these. I sleep better at night knowing my family is safer. I purchased 2 so there is one at each end of the upstairs. My kids feel safer too.
customer_reviews.author: vrdry

customer_reviews.title: This item is sent in its original box which feature ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is sent in its original box which feature only tab enclosure with no tape, adhesive or outer box. As a life saving, or potentially life saving device, I find this unacceptable. There is no way to know if anyone opened, or tampered with, the contents. I believe the full filment of this item is irresponsible on behalf of the manu facturer and ama zon. The product may be A-OK, but you need to know that before you order.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: The ladder comes out of the box easily and has "ears" that fit over the window sill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my daughter's college apartment. Though I hope she never has to use it, it just gives a person peace of mind to know that she at least has a way to get down from the second floor apartment. I opened the box to inspect the item and it looks well made. It is a one use only product though. It is much lighter and smaller than the chain and steel tubing fire ladder we currently have in our home. The ladder comes out of the box easily and has "ears" that fit over the window sill. It looks like it can be quickly and easily deployed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One time use - really!
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed to learn that this is a single use ladder. I was prepared to have fire drill only to learn to make sure we were comfortable using the ladder we could not reuse. So you can only pray everything goes well in an actual emergency.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy J. Minor

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used it, but it CAN be refolded. I think there is safety liability issues so they have to say once it's unfurled it can't be used again. That simply isn't true. But do take care in folding it back up so if needed in an emergency it will easily expand to its full length.
customer_reviews.author: MoniQ

customer_reviews.title: Feels wobbly and unstable
customer_reviews.text: This product has promise in that it was easy to use, however after purchasing it and testing it from my second-story window it felt wobbly and very shaky so much so that one of my sons refused to use it during our fire drill, and the other felt terrified after trying it. They need to design something a bit sturdier. In a real fire emergency we need to have more confidence in something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Zeus

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully we'll never need it, but affordable peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: We have a deck that is 20+ feet in the air with no route of escape other than a small spiral stairway. This is something we hope to never have to use, but given the price I think it's a small price to pay for some "safety insurance" just in case. Hopefully we'll never need it, but it's affordable and gives us a small peace of mind, "just in case". I did a quick test with it hanging over the railing of the deck. I made it to the ground just fine (though looked a big clumsy doing it), so I'm sure if there were a fire I or my guests could survive, even in the chaos.
customer_reviews.author: FlyboyyyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than i thought
customer_reviews.text: Well thank God I haven't had to use it. I haven't gotten it out and worked with it yet (planning on going over fire safety again with the family, need to actually do it!) It is heavier than i thought. It's a bit bulky/clumsy, where i do wonder how my coordinated 9 year old son would do with it, if needed. But more the reason for practice. Definitely looks sturdy and like it would hold adults.
customer_reviews.author: Joyfulmama

customer_reviews.title: Just what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: We obviously haven’t use this yet because there has not been a fire, thankfully. But I noticed some of the other reviews where buyers were concerned because it was a one use ladder. I’m guessing that you can use this to pretend you’re in an emergency to test it. I am assuming the one use refers to if there were an actual fire and it had fire or smoke damage so you would not be able to use it a second time. It appears to be great quality however.
customer_reviews.author: Princess79

customer_reviews.title: Only works once...
customer_reviews.text: This emergency ladder is nice and long. However, it can only be used once. So you can't REALLY practice with it unless you are willing to buy a second one after your fire drill. I am glad I read the directions in the box because I didn't get that from the post.
customer_reviews.author: Rell

customer_reviews.title: Works for the purpose at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I tried this the other day. It was very daunting climbing out of our second story window. The ladder moves and twists and there is a technique to getting down safely. I climbed down it and I’m 150lbs. The metal steps are sharp and I was worried about my kids getting cut by it when trying to deploy the ladder and the sharp steps did scratch up the brick siding of our house a little. In an emergency situation it is much safer then jumping out the window. We have 5 rooms upstairs, so I bought 2 emergency ladders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need the right house
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a long reach over a roof line that projects out from our second story. HOWEVER if your home does not have a window that is set flush to the exterior of the home this ladder will be very flimsy and hard to stabilize while going up or down. This ladder has standoffs that need a backing to make them stable and that is where the side of the house comes in. Without that, in our case, the evac ladder is pretty useless. We bought the shorter version to test this out and it was scary. Sending the long one back unused.
customer_reviews.author: ged 1

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and great ease of use, plus excellent price
customer_reviews.text: My family are firefighters. This product came well-packaged with clear one-time use instructions. The price is great. I have 3 2nd floor bedrooms plus bonus room and wanted to be sure I had an escape route out a window should the stairs be blocked by fire. This company Kidde makes fire extinguishers as well. I keep 1 extinguisher upstairs in the same room as these fire ladder stairs, near the window. Great for a gift - which might save the life of someone you care about, too!
customer_reviews.author: southerngal

customer_reviews.title: Great housewarming gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these when I bought my first home, so when my younger sister bought her first home, I knew I had to give her one of these as well. She loved it! It's not your typical housewarming gift, but it's definitly a necessity. You hope you never need it, but it's good to have around just in case you do. She said she hadn't even considered the need for one of these. I hadn't either when I first got my house.. I just happened ot sign up for a workshop at a local hardware store where they first introduced me to this item. A must for any new homeowner!
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: Feeling much safer.
customer_reviews.text: I tested the hooks on my window sill and it works just fine. As recommended, I DID NOT deploy the steps. This is a one-time use ladder and deploying the steps for "practice" could compromise it for the "real thing". I pray to God I never have to use it because it feels a long way down to the ground from my 2nd floor. But it's under my window along with my baby rescue bag (for my dog). Praying we never have to use either but prepared just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Girl

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Ladder
customer_reviews.text: This a well made sturdy ladder but had to send it back because it was difficult to use and very heavy.. We bought the 3 story one, too difficult and heavy to use..awkward trying to get it untangled and took awhile to figure out how to open it up and use..too much precious tine wasted in a true emergeny.. Very cumbersome at the 3 story one we had... moving on to X-It one when it goes on sale..
customer_reviews.author: Dynabird

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: it works, and I feel that it would be great if we ever have a need to use them, but we run firedrills in our home (I want my kids to know how to escape if the need arises and they need to know how to use the everything), and when we ran the drill, we threw the ladder over a window ledge to climb out. We successfully climbed out of the window and got to the ground safely, but the rungs that support the ladder to the wall bent and made the ladder almost unusable, we might be ok if the kids only use it. I weigh about 180lbs and my wife is 145.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: It looks like a sturdy and well made product
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a sturdy and well made product. I was hoping to be able to practice using it, but the directions state "one time use only". In light of not being able to actually try out the device, I would recommend taking it out of the box, removing all of the shipping tape and shrink wrap, and just getting familiar with it. I moved a few shirts and hung mine on a closet rod so it will be easily available if it is ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: L. South

customer_reviews.title: We had been thinking of getting one for a while
customer_reviews.text: As with most customers of this product, we haven't had to use it and hopefully never will. But I feel much better knowing we have it in our house. We live in a 3 story and I was a little nervous that the 3 story ladder would be really heavy, but all 3 of us could lift it (2 adults and teen). The instructions seem easy to follow and the construction of the ladder looks sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L.

customer_reviews.title: Not for Kids
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 6 years old and 3 years old. Wanted them to practice climbing down from the bedroom so they are prepared in the case of a house fire. You're only supposed to use it once. It is heavy and I don't believe together they could actually get it in the window. I assume it's sturdy from the weight of it. I pray we never have to find out if they can get it in the window.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Downs

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: REALLY UNHAPPY! The description of the item should show this has ONE use only!!!!!!! You can’t even practice using it. Box appears to be a return from somebody else. Was retapped. PLUS CHARGED $12.00 FOR RETURN SHIPPING.
customer_reviews.author: Marguerita Silver

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Only reduction in stars was due to weight. I'm 6', 240#'s. Not a problem, but smaller folks, in a nuts-out panic during a fire, may have trouble with the weight. Not crazy heavy but VERY STURDY "weighty" It also labeled as "single use" because the are not taking responsibility for you not folding it back up correctly and burning up. Take a few pictures of it folded up, hang it out the winder, do a few practice runs, and fold it back up. Good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Joey VanOstrand

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: I am prepared to use this in the event of such an emergency. I hope the day never arises where my family needs this, but being on the second floor last bedroom at the end of a hallway we felt this a reasonable price for peace of mind and our safety. We've looked over the unit enough to familiarize ourselves with it should we ever need it, but did not test it out. I hope we never have to, but are happy with the item and how it feels and operates based on reading the instructions for it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Safety Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this safety ladder for a fire plan. Our windows are approx two to three stories up for the bedrooms. If we were trapped upstairs by fire, we would not have a way to get down. This ladder is nice and lightweight so that children wouldn't have a hard time to move it around if they have to. If is in a nice compact box that I just keep it in and store upstairs in one of the bedrooms available if we ever have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Ladder isn't actually long enough to reach ground from my 3rd floor apartment  as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Ladder isn't actually long enough to reach ground from my third floor apartment as advertised. In addition the part that hits below a window won't work on my balcony because it only hits air or the 1" wide rail which it slides off of. I must buy something else. Due to the seller's one month (no) return policy I'm stuck with this item. NOT GOOD BUSINESS!
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Know the height of your 2nd story window.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this as I wanted to use this to get to a place in my attic that is not accessible. I thought maybe I could hang it from a beam but that’s not what it was intended for but I’d hoped it’d work, it didn’t. It appears to be good for its intended use and if my house wasn’t as tall as it is floor to floor. I’d keep it but my 2nd story window is about 10 feet higher than typical so that last 10 feet would be a big jump to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Important safety item for upstairs
customer_reviews.text: Beyond the review of actually putting this to use, no fire so far, luckily...it is sturdy and seemingly easy to use. It is for an upstairs bedroom. It shipped fast but the item was not in a Amazon sturdy box, only manufacturer box and it was half open. Only one little piece of plain shipping tape kinda holding it together. This item weighs a few lbs. Luckily it survived quite well.
customer_reviews.author: GAIL SUTHERLAND

customer_reviews.title: People complain they can't climb up? duh
customer_reviews.text: Thie ladder is a one time use so you should be desending instead of jumping to the ground, but not using it to climb up. I compare this to a knotted rope and chose this instead. You can't decend a knotted rope if you can't tie it to something and who has time in a smokey room to figure that out. Besides go price a 50 foot 1/2" rope that will hold 500 lbs, and this ladder holds 1000lbs!
customer_reviews.author: Mur Man

customer_reviews.title: Whoops
customer_reviews.text: I had a traumatic dream that I was suffocating in a fire and couldn’t escape my house. As soon as I awoke from the dream, I grabbed my phone, opened Amazon, and promptly spent $200+ on a wide array of fire safety equipment; this ladder being one of my frantic purchases. I’m assuming it’s a nice fire ladder, it seems very nice, but I ultimately decided to return it because my house is only one story.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: A need in every home that has more then one story
customer_reviews.text: This product is hard to review, because the main purpose is to use in the case of Emergencies... The best thing to say is its light, and sturdy looking. Should be fine for what the purpose is intended If the day should arise. Again, the hope is Not to have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Hope to never have to use
customer_reviews.text: But if I do I feel confident in the design and the use. It is easily stored in the closet next to the window so that would be easy to access as it is lightweight. I have not deployed the device because I have read that the device is not intended to be put back together. I understand the rationale for a single use device, much like a fire extinguisher.
customer_reviews.author: schlemm

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sturdy ladder!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, study ladder. Hopefully we won't ever have to use it but it's compact and rolls out easily. We did a test run and the only complaint is while I don't find it heavy (I'm a fairly small woman) my kids found it to be a bit heavy (they're 9 & 7). So make sure your kiddos can get this into a window before you trust them to use it as a safety device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but...
customer_reviews.text: This will undoubtedly save your life, if you can figure out how to stop the support bars from collapsing while you are trying to put it in the window. If the support bars did not fold and collapse, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rural Camper

customer_reviews.title: Kidde The best name in the business! This is a must have for everyone living on the second floor!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have fro everyone living on the second floor! If you live on a second floor and you don't have one of these you are crazy! Imagine, God For Bid there is a fire and you have to go out your window. Without this ladder you will be breaking some major bones and/or be killed! The price is great and your life and families life is surely worth it! Get one before it is too late!!! It works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: TheMan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Emergency Use
customer_reviews.text: The main detraction of this ladder is that it is intended for a single deployment. This is not because it will fall apart, but because the retention system they use to keep the ladder folded is made of cardboard which you tear when deploying it. You can test mount it to your windowsill, but can't deploy it and expect to fold it up neatly again. We keep ours next to the bed in our class A RV.
customer_reviews.author: Dee NTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great quality, helps you to feel safe in case of emergancies.
customer_reviews.text: We live upstairs in an unconventional building with only one set of stairs and the 2nd floor is around 15 feet up. We can hang this over the balcony and escape if need be at any time. The only reason I didnt give it 5 stars is that the frame which you attach doesn't fit the balcony rail which is a flat 2x8 as well as I would like but it does work so I am happy with the product and feel much safer having it.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: In case of emergency
customer_reviews.text: No one ever wants to have to use these things but it gives me peace of mind that we have them in both rooms upstairs should we ever need them. We had to get the 3 story due to how our roof line is but they seem great. We know that should we need to use them, we have them and we’ll safely be able to get to the ground! I checked all the weight limits and all is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Gomila

customer_reviews.title: What does a life cost
customer_reviews.text: I have a Queen Ann Victorian house (balloon construction) All it took was a fire once to see how fast any house can burn. So over time I put one of these in each room from the second floor up. MONEY WELL SPENT I deployed it and tested Im not gonna say its like walking down a set of stairs.but If the choice is wait and choke or burn I'll risk falling. I didn't test this but its possible if you're fit enough to have a small child hug you and go down together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2nd story master bedroom. Don't want to be stuck there is a fire breaks out downstairs. Looks easy to use, have not tried to open it up but the directions are clear. Just hope I never have to use it :-) Good price for this brand/model. I know this is a 3-story ladder and I said 2nd floor, but my BR window opens out on a car garage overhang that's about 6 foot long, and didn't want a 2-story ladder to end up too short.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lavigne

customer_reviews.title: It might work in a emergency
customer_reviews.text: The handles are strong, long but be careful the steps are metal sharp and cut your skin easily.
customer_reviews.author: claud

customer_reviews.title: Tested it--unstable, hard to use,moved a lot--I will not let my kid use this product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 packs and they are low quality ladders. I thought about returning them, but it had been a while to be qualified to return. I opened one and tested it. The ladder could not stay stable. It moved too much and was very hard to maintain balance for me to climb.
customer_reviews.author: Tbag

customer_reviews.title: 1 time use.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot try it out because it is one time use.😒
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you need it you’ll be glad you have it
customer_reviews.text: Keeping in mind what this is used for, I would have to say that if you need it, you would likely be glad you had it. However I feel it is very heavy, awkward, and impossible to operate in any kind of panic situation. Edges are rough, if not sharp. Although it’s still probably the best way out of a 3 story building fire, there could be some improvement.
customer_reviews.author: iMom

customer_reviews.title: great for older kids or adults
customer_reviews.text: One Time use, as other reviews state. Can not practice, and for a child, this is very intimidating. it claims slip proof, but for something that sits on a window seal, and you have to trust your weight on it, it def doesnt seem safe! if i hadnt thrown the box away, because it was in pieces by the time it arrived, i would have returned it, because it seems jumping may be safer then this!!! beware. again, great for older kids or adults, if you think you can manage to figure this out in a panic! again, just hope and pray ill never have to use it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Ladder
customer_reviews.text: We received this product, it is as it is stated. But, folding it up is a real BEAR. It gets twisted up and it takes two people to put back together. We will keep it as it will save our lives if we ever have a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Lavonne

customer_reviews.title: Defective design. Return for refund.
customer_reviews.text: Very Poor design. The inside hook has to catch the side of the sill. That is all that is supporting the weight on the inside... a sliver of wood for the window sill. I expect this to fall right out of the window during the first use. Do Not trust this design and I will return this defective product.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use this yet and I hope I never will have to. I got it for emergency since I live on the 2nd floor Apt. I did test it by dropping it out the window to see if it is long enough to reach the ground. It feels sturdy enough as a ladder to go from 2nd floor to the ground floor. Most of the ladder is made with metal, so the quality is there. The hardest part will be finding the right place to hook it to.
customer_reviews.author: Nincat

customer_reviews.title: Think of this as life insurance!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of mind for my second story living. Like our fire extinguishers, I hope I never need this but I would rather give these a shot than jumping from a 15 foot window. I only have one window and it is opposite the door, so this is smart planning. I found a nice decorative wooden box (looks like a treasure chest) to store it in near the window.
customer_reviews.author: KirkMoto

customer_reviews.title: Easy use
customer_reviews.text: The day we received this I had my boys deploy and use them out the window. Thay easily did it on their own and where able to climb down safely. As a firefighter I highly recommend everyone on the second story or higher have one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lindau

customer_reviews.title: Safety ladder
customer_reviews.text: The ladder and hooks seem very sturdy. I live in a townhouse. Bedrooms on the 3rd floor would be difficult to egress during a fire so I purchased 2 of these. I pray I never need to use them but if I do, I'll update my review. It brings a degree of safety having them available if a fire ever does break out while we are asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S.

customer_reviews.title: Can't put a price on fire safety!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these, one for each 2nd floor bedroom. It gives me great peace of mind knowing my kids have and additional escape route in the event of a fire should I not be able to get to them. A must have for any house or apartment with 2 or more levels. Make sure you take ladder out of box and store it close to the window that would be used for escape. Show your kids how to place on window. Make sure you teach your kids how to use this ladder and practice home fire drills. Should you ever have a house fire .....there are no re-do's for potentially life threatening mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: KateUSA

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the wrong thing. I thought this would ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the wrong thing. I thought this would fit on a railing in an apartment. It did not. Never could get them to refund and have me ship back to them. Very dissatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Betty J. Deshong

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to get off my second story balcony from my bedroom if there is a fire or home break in. I keep outside in a waterproof plastic toolbox that doubles as a steps tool to get over the rail if needed by shorter folks. Makes me feel better that I won’t be trapped in the bedroom or balcony if an emergency occurs downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: feather

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will work fine
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to review this because it says it’s a one time use and it looks like it would be hard to get it folded back up after it has been deployed. I looks like it will do the job. It does give me peace of mind to know it’s there just in case
customer_reviews.author: Gigi 42

customer_reviews.title: Window escape ladder
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a great escape ladder for our 2 story home. Read the reviews and checked on the price on the Kidde. So i took a chance. It arrived a day early so shipping is 10 out of 10!! It was also packed really good! 9 out of 10. Looked on the box for instructions on how to use it. Pulled the ladder out of the box. customer_reviews.author: Kai

product_meta.title: Kidde 468193 KL-2S Two-Story Fire Escape Ladder with Anti-Slip Rungs, 13-Foot
product_meta.description:
Size:13-Foot| Style:Ladder13', 2 Story, Emergency Escape Ladder, Tangle Free Design, Tested To 1,000 LB, No Tools or Assembly Required, 5 Year Limited Warranty, Boxed.

AMAZON.COM
Available in 13-foot and 25-foot models, Kidde Escape Ladders offer a quick and easy escape from two- or three-story homes. These life-saving ladders store compactly, deploy quickly, and keep you prepared for the possibility of fire and other emergencies. Kidde Escape Ladders attach quickly to most windows, and they are tangle free, stretching out to form a flame resistant, durable, and sturdy ladder that can support up to 1,000 pounds.



Fire Safety for Your Home
The National Fire Protection Association recommends storing one ladder in every occupied room of your home that is above the main level. With a Kidde Escape ladder, you can keep your family and children safe in the event of a fire or other emergency.Ideal for Second- or Third-Story Escapes
The Kidde Escape Ladder is available in two models. Each model features a strong and lightweight design, compact storability, and one-foot wide rungs.

The Kidde KL-2S extends to 13 feet for use in second-story rooms, and the Kidde KL-3S extends to 25 feet for an escape route from third-story rooms.

Quick and Easy to Use
Kidde Escape Ladders store compactly and don't deploy until you need them. Each ladder fits easily under a bed or in a closet near the window. If a fire necessitates an escape from the second or third story of your home, it's easy to move a Kidde Escape Ladder to the window, open and place the attachment hooks over the windowsill, and pull the release strap to unfurl the ladder.

Warning: Kidde Escape Ladders are designed for one-time use only. Discard after single use. Repeat use may result in injury or death.

Strong and Durable
With metal rungs and red nylon strap rails, Kidde Escape Ladders can support up to 750 pounds on one rung or 1,000 pounds when the load is distributed on more than one rung.

Anti-slip, zinc-plated steel rungs prevent slipping and ensure a safe descent, and the ladders are flame resistant for increased protection.

Kidde Escape Ladders are backed by a five-year manufacturer's limited warranty.
